lead_paragraph: O'NEILL--Jack. 86 years old, born Brooklyn, NY. Passed away at home on April 5th, 2016. Devoted husband of Jaine, loving brother of Patricia Holst, brother-in- law of Peter and Reelika Janoff, adored uncle of many nieces nephews and great- nieces and great-nephews. Army Veteran of the Korean War. Co-founder with George Mourges of JG Melon, upper east side's famous saloon. Since opening its doors in 1972, this institution has welcomed, politicians, prime ministers, presidents, movie stars, artists and writers as well as the neighborhood crowd. Jack was a familiar figure around town with impeccable taste in all things. Jack had two passions in life: his wife of 33 years, to whom he often said, "my job is to make you happy," and his golf game, about which he loved to brag that he could shoot his age, although he remarked it was getting easier as he got older. Jack's favorite time of the year was opening weekend of the golf season at Noyac Golf Club, Sag Harbor, NY, where he was a valued member since 1982. Known for his wit and generosity among family, friends, golf buddies and staff and patrons of his restaurants, genius storyteller and master of zingers, you always knew exactly where you stood with Jack. He will be missed. A memorial service will be held on Monday, April 11th at 11:30am, Frank E. Campbell Funeral Home (The Funeral Chapel) located at 1076 Madison Avenue in New York City, New York (81st St). In lieu of flowers, the family requests donations be made to the Dana Farber Cancer Institute, PO Box 849168, Boston, MA, 02884-9168. Please mention in memory of Jack O'Neill gift for the Mesothelioma Research Fund. 1/3
